  • havoc.autoval.tests.drive_cache_config.drive_cache_config

Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.drive_cache_config.drive_cache_config

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.drive import DriveType
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.storage_test_base import StorageTestBase



[docs]class DriveCacheConfig(StorageTestBase):

    # @override

[docs]    def storage_test_setup(self):
        # only pick HDD for testing
        self.test_control["drive_type"] = DriveType.HDD.value
        self._install_dependencies()
        super(DriveCacheConfig, self).storage_test_setup()



[docs]    def execute(self):
        """
        Perform the following test on drive cache
        Steps:
            - Get original state
            - Swap state
            - Cycle drive if save_state is True
            - Check if state has been changed
            - Swap back to original state
            - Cycle drive if save_state is True
            - Check if state reverted to original
        """
        self.save_state = self.test_control.get("save_state")
        for drive in self.test_drives:
            self.test_change_write_cache(drive)
            self.test_change_read_lookahead(drive)



[docs]    def test_change_read_lookahead(self, drive):
        org_state = drive.get_read_lookahead()

        self._toggle_read_lookahead(org_state, drive)

        if self.save_state:
            self._reset_drive(drive)

        curr_state = drive.get_read_lookahead()

        self.validate_condition(
            org_state != curr_state,
            "Changed read lookahead for /dev/%s" % (
                drive.block_name
            )
        )

        self._toggle_read_lookahead(curr_state, drive)

        if self.save_state:
            self._reset_drive(drive)

        curr_state = drive.get_read_lookahead()

        self.validate_equal(
            org_state,
            curr_state,
            "Reverted /dev/%s read lookahead to original value" % (
                drive.block_name
            )
        )



[docs]    def test_change_write_cache(self, drive):
        org_state = drive.get_write_cache()

        self._toggle_write_cache(org_state, drive)

        if self.save_state:
            self._reset_drive(drive)

        curr_state = drive.get_write_cache()

        self.validate_condition(
            org_state != curr_state,
            "Changed write cache for /dev/%s" % drive.block_name
        )

        self._toggle_write_cache(curr_state, drive)

        if self.save_state:
            self._reset_drive(drive)

        curr_state = drive.get_write_cache()

        self.validate_equal(
            org_state,
            curr_state,
            "Reverted /dev/%s write cache to original value" % drive.block_name
        )



[docs]    def _toggle_write_cache(self, state, drive):
        """
        @param int state: 0 for disabled, 1 for enabled
        @param Drive drive
        """
        if state:
            drive.disable_write_cache(save=self.save_state)
        else:
            drive.enable_write_cache(save=self.save_state)



[docs]    def _toggle_read_lookahead(self, state, drive):
        """
        @param int state: 0 for disabled, 1 for enabled
        @param Drive drive
        """
        if state:
            drive.disable_read_lookahead(save=self.save_state)
        else:
            drive.enable_read_lookahead(save=self.save_state)


    def _reset_drive(self, drive):
        self.log_info("Resetting drive /dev/{}".format(drive.block_name))
        drive.reset()

    def _install_dependencies(self):
        old_host = AutovalUtils.get_host()
        AutovalUtils.set_host(self.host)
        AutovalUtils.install_rpms(["hdparm", "sdparm"])
        AutovalUtils.set_host(old_host)




[docs]def main():
    test = DriveCacheConfig()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
